meanings.definition: Not conforming to accepted standards of morality.
meanings.sent1: The story had an unmoral character who always lied and cheated.
meanings.sent2: His actions were considered unmoral by the community.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to see the unmoral behavior of the mischievous squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The unmoral decisions he made painted a dark shadow over his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of the unmoral act stayed with me for days.

meanings.sent1: The unmoral individual showed no remorse for his harmful actions.
meanings.sent2: Her unmoral behavior shocked those around her.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unmoral disregard for the house rules was both funny and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: In a world of honesty, his unmoral ways stood out like a sore thumb.
meanings.sent5: The unmoral nature of the crime left a lasting impact on the community.

meanings.sent1: The decision to cut corners was deemed unmoral by the ethics committee.
meanings.sent2: She found herself in an unmoral dilemma that tested her values.
meanings.sent3: The unmoral twist in the fairy tale made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His unmoral actions spoke louder than any words could.
meanings.sent5: The unmoral path he chose led to his downfall.
